record_data.record_plain_text: -2- Section 3 Exhibits The following Exhibits are attached to this Agreement and by this reference incorporated herein: Exhibit A Points of DeliveryExhibit B Meter Reading and Meter Test ProceduresExhibit C Substation Construction and Ownership Guidelines
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: -2- Section 2 Term of Agreement 2.1 Effective Date. The effective date of this Agreement (Effective Date) shall be the later of: (a) the date first written in this Agreement; or (b) the date this Agreement is accepted for filing by the Commission, without any change or condition by the Commission which is unacceptable to either PSE or Kittitas; provided, however, that by executing this Agreement Kittitas does not consent to any jurisdiction by the Commission that the Commission does not already have over Kittitas. 2.2 Term. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue through the fifth anniversary of the Effective Date.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: Section 5 Points of Delivery and Facilities 5.1 Changes and Additions to Points of Delivery. During the term of this Agreement, Kittitas may, in accordance with Good Utility Practice and, when applicable, upon PSEs approval, add new or change existing Points of Delivery to facilitate Transmission Service under the Tariff. Subject to the foregoing, the Parties shall add any such new Point of Delivery concurrent with the commencement of Transmission Service under the Tariff to such new Point of Delivery. 5.2 Ownership of Facilities. (a) Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Agreement, ownership of any and all equipment and all salvable facilities installed or previously installed by either Party on the property of the other Party shall be and remain with the Party that owned such equipment and facilities at the time of installation. (b) Each Party shall identify all movable equipment and, to the extent agreed upon by the Parties, all other salvable facilities that are installed by such Party on the property of the other, by permanently affixing thereto suitable markers plainly identifying the owner of the equipment and facilities. Within a reasonable time subsequent to initial installation, and subsequent to any modification of such installation, representatives of the Parties shall jointly prepare an itemized list of said movable equipment and salvable facilities so installed indicating the respective owners thereof. (c) Each Party shall be responsible for the cost of compliance with the requirements of all applicable federal, state, and local environmental laws for its own facilities and equipment, even when such facilities and equipment are located on the property of the other Party. (d) Construction and ownership of facilities inside a PSE substation shall be subject to the Substation Construction and Ownership Guidelines outlined in Exhibit C, attached hereto. 5.3 Addition of Facilities. Any incremental costs of additions or modifications to PSEs equipment and facilities in order to provide Transmission Service or Ancillary Services at the Points of Delivery shall be provided for pursuant to the Tariff. 5.4 Permits. (a) If any equipment or facilities associated with any Point of Delivery and owned by a Party are, or are planned to be, located on the property of the other Party, such other Party hereby grants to such owning Party a right to (i) install, test, maintain, inspect, replace, repair and operate such equipment and facilities during the term of this Agreement and to remove such equipment and facilities at the expiration or termination of the term of this Agreement, together with the right of access to such property at all reasonable times; provided, however, that no right to perform ground excavation is granted pursuant to this Section 5.4(a). (b) Each Party shall have the right at all reasonable times to enter the property of the other Party for the purpose of reading any and all meters referred to in this Agreement that are installed on such property; provided, however, that such right shall be consistent with and subject to any applicable national security and electrical reliability requirements. (c) If either Party is required or entitled hereunder to install, test, maintain, inspect, replace, repair, remove or operate equipment on the property of the other Party, the owner of such property shall finish the other Party with accurate drawings and wiring diagrams of associated equipment and facilities, or, if such drawings or diagrams are not available, shall furnish accurate information regarding such equipment or facilities. The owner of such property shall notify the other Party of any subsequent modification that may affect the duties of the other Party in regard to such equipment, and shall furnish the other Party with accurate revised drawings, if possible. 5.5 Inspection of Facilities. Either Party may inspect the other Partys electric installation for any reasonable purpose at any reasonable time upon reasonable notice to such other Party. Such inspection, or failure to inspect, shall not give rise to any liability or responsibility on the part of such Party, its officers, agents, or employees, for any injury, loss, damage or accident resulting from defects in such electric installation, or for any breach or violation of this Agreement. The inspecting Party shall observe written instructions and notices posted in facilities and such other necessary instructions or standards for inspection as the Parties may agree upon (such agreement not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed). Only Generating Projects and those electric installations used in complying with the terms of this Agreement shall be subject to inspection.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: -2- Section 4 Services Provided by PSE or Other Parties 4.1 Transmission Service. Kittitas, or Bonneville on behalf of Kittitas, requires Transmission Service to the Points of Delivery in order to serve Kittitass Native Load Customers. Transmission Service is not provided for under this Agreement, but shall be provided for pursuant to the Tariff and other agreements contemplated by the Tariff between the Parties or between PSE and Bonneville. 4.2 Ancillary Services. Kittitas, or Bonneville on behalf of Kittitas, requires Ancillary Services in order to serve Kittitass Native Load Customers via the Points of Delivery. Ancillary Services are not provided for under this Agreement, but shall be provided for pursuant to the Tariff and another agreement contemplated by the Tariff between the Parties or between PSE and Bonneville.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: Puget Sound Energy, Inc. Original Sheet No. 18 Original Service Agreement No. 508 Issued by: John Phillips Effective Date: September 1, 2010 Manager, Transmission Contracts and OASIS Trading Issued on: November 2, 2010 PUGET SOUND ENERGY, INC. ORIGINAL SERVICE AGREEMENT NO. 508
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: EXHIBIT CPOINT OF DELIVERY; CONSTRUCTION GUIDELINES 1. Metering equipment shall be supplied and owned by PSE. 2. PSE will install 34.5 kV metering instrument transformers (CTs and PTs). These instrument transformers will be dedicated to the revenue metering and the secondary circuits will not be shared with other Kittitas-owned devices. 3. Kittitas shall provide the hardware and conductor to connect to the source at the Point of Delivery. 4. For the purpose of enabling PSE to monitor the loads on its transmission system in real time, PSE shall provide megawatt and megavar indications for total substation load from Kittitass supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system, if existing, in a format agreed upon by the Parties. PSE will install an RTU and a dedicated communications channel for the operational data. Communications will consist of either a PSE fiber optic cable between the delivery points and PSEs Cle Elum Substation, a phone circuit and point-to-point radios between the delivery points and PSEs Cle Elum Substation, or a phone circuit and 4-wire data circuit leased from the telephone company. 5. PSE will, pursuant to terms and conditions mutually acceptable to both PSE and Kittitas, assign any and all easements to Kittitas for facilities beyond the Point of Delivery and transfer ownership of the existing 34.5 kV underground cable and related terminations and risers to Kittitas. 6. Kittitas will provide PSE with a single-line diagram as well as an updated one-line diagram when changes to the Point of Delivery are completed.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: Section 1 Definitions 1.1 Ancillary Services means those services that are necessary to support the transmission of capacity and energy from resources to loads while maintaining reliable operation of PSEs Transmission System in accordance with Good Utility Practice. 1.2 Commission means the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, or its regulatory successor. 1.3 Direct Assignment Facilities means facilities or portions of facilities that are constructed by PSE for the sole use or benefit of Kittitas. 1.4 Good Utility Practice means (a) any of the practices, methods and acts engaged in or approved by a significant portion of the electric utility industry during the relevant time period, or (b) in the absence of such practices, methods and acts, the practices, methods and acts which, in the exercise of reasonable judgment in light of the facts known at the time the decision was made, could have been expected to accomplish the desired result at a reasonable cost consistent with good business practices, reliability, safety, and expedition. Good Utility Practice is not intended to be limited to the optimum practice, method or act to the exclusion of all others, but rather to be a range of acceptable practices, methods or acts. 1.5 Generating Project means any electric generating facility, whether owned by Kittitas or a third party, located in an area served by Kittitas that is electrically connected to PSEs electric system. 1.6 IEEE means the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers, or its successor. 1.7 Native Load Customers means the wholesale and retail power customers of either Party on whose behalf that Party, by statute, franchise, regulatory requirement or contract, undertakes an obligation to construct and operate that Partys system to meet the reliable electric needs of such customers. 1.8 NERC means the North American Electric Reliability Council, or its successor. 1.9 NWPP means the Northwest Power Pool, or its successor. 1.10 Point(s) of Delivery means those points of interconnection as specified in Exhibit A attached to this Agreement. 1.11 Power Agreements means the executed power sales agreements by and between Bonneville and Kittitas effective May 28, 2010. 1.12 Service Commencement Date means the date on which PSE first commences providing network integration transmission service to Kittitas or to Bonneville pursuant to a network integration transmission service agreement under the Tariff for the delivery of electric power to Kittitas. 1.13 Tariff means PSEs Open Access Transmission Tariff, FERC Electric Tariff Volume No. 7, as such may be amended or replaced. 1.14 Transmission Service means network integration transmission service, including transfer service over substation facilities, distribution facilities, or Direct Assignment Facilities, provided by PSE pursuant to the Tariff. 1.15 WECC means the Western Electricity Coordinating Council, or its successor.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: -1- INTERCONNECTION AND OPERATING AGREEMENTbetweenPUGET SOUND ENERGY, INC.andPUBLIC UTILITY DISTRICT No. 1 of KITTITAS COUNTY This INTERCONNECTION AND OPERATING AGREEMENT (Agreement) is dated as of May 28, 2010, by and between PUGET SOUND ENERGY, INC (PSE) and PUBLIC UTILITY DISTRICT No. 1 of KITTITAS COUNTY, Washington (Kittitas). Each of PSE and Kittitas may sometimes be referred to in this Service Agreement as Party; both of PSE and Kittitas may sometimes be referred to in this Service Agreement together as Parties. RECITALS WHEREAS, PSE and Kittitas currently operate interconnected electric systems; and WHEREAS, in order to facilitate the continued delivery of electric power from the Bonneville Power Administration (Bonneville) to Kittitas, PSE and Bonneville intend to execute a service agreement under PSEs Open Access Transmission Tariff, pursuant to which PSE will provide network integration transmission service to Bonneville for such deliveries to Kittitas; and WHEREAS, at some future time Kittitas may elect to execute a service agreement under PSEs Tariff, replacing the aforementioned agreement between PSE and Bonneville, to facilitate the delivery of electric power to Kittitas; and WHEREAS, PSE and Kittitas desire to provide for the terms and conditions for the operation and maintenance of their interconnected electric systems following the effectiveness of this Agreement. AGREEMENT NOW, THEREFORE, the Parties agree as follows:
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: -2- Section 6 Metering 6.1 Meters and Meter Reading. Unless otherwise agreed to by the Parties, PSE shall own and maintain all meters used to determine any billing associated with this Agreement, any service agreement under the Tariff providing for the delivery of electric power to the Point(s) of Delivery, or any other agreement between the Parties. Meters at the Point(s) of Delivery shall be read pursuant to the Meter Reading and Meter Test Procedures outlined in Exhibit B attached hereto. 6.2 Tests of Metering Installations. Each Party shall, at its expense, test its measuring installations associated with this Agreement, a service agreement under the Tariff providing for the delivery of electric power to the Point(s) of Delivery, or any other agreement between the Parties, in accordance with the Meter Reading and Meter Test Procedures outlined in Exhibit B attached hereto. The Parties may mutually agree to use a single set of meters. In the event that a single set of meters are used, tests of such meters shall be conducted jointly by the Parties in accordance with Exhibit B and shall be witnessed and agreed to by one or more representatives of each Party. 6.3 Metering and Communications Required for Ancillary Services. Kittitas shall be responsible, to the extent it is not provided that Bonneville will be so responsible pursuant to its agreement with Kittitas, for all costs associated with the installation, operation, and maintenance of any metering and communications equipment necessary for the provision of Ancillary Services either by PSE, Kittitas, or by a third party. All such metering installations shall be installed, operated, and maintained pursuant to applicable NERC, WECC, and NWPP criteria and Good Utility Practice. 6.4 Measurements and Installation of PSE Meters. Notwithstanding any other provision in this Section 6, PSE may at any time install meters or metering equipment to make any measurements for any Point of Delivery required for any computation or determination mentioned in this Agreement, a service agreement under the Tariff providing for the delivery of electric power to the Point(s) of Delivery, or any other agreement between the Parties, and if such meters or metering equipment are so installed, such measurements shall be used thereafter in such computation or determination. 6.5 Real-Time Data Acquisition. For the purpose of enabling PSE to monitor the loads on its transmission system, PSE may require the acquisition of real-time load data (megawatts and megavars) at Points of Delivery at or above 12.5 kV. The Parties shall facilitate such data acquisition pursuant to the Substation Construction and Ownership Guidelines outlined in the attached Exhibit C.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: Section 14 Governing Law This Agreement shall be interpreted, construed and enforced in accordance with the laws of the state of Washington or the law of the United States of America, whichever is applicable, as if executed and to be performed wholly within the state of Washington.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: Section 13 No Dedication of Facilities Any undertaking by one Party to another Party under any provision of this Agreement shall not constitute the dedication of the electric system or any portion thereof of the undertaking Party to the public or to the other Party, and it is understood and agreed that any such undertaking under any provision of this Agreement by a Party shall cease upon the termination of such Partys obligations under this Agreement.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have caused this Agreement to be executed in their respective names by their duly authorized representatives as of the date first noted above. PUGET SOUND ENERGY, INC. PUBLIC UTILITY DISTRICT No. 1 ofKITTITAS COUNTY By: /s/ John Phillips By: /s/ Kim Mikkelsen John Phillips Kim Mikkelsen Manager, Electric Transmission Kittitas PUD Interim Manager Signed this 23rd day of July, 2010 Signed this 2nd day of July, 2010
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: EXHIBIT BMETER READING AND METER TEST PROCEDURES B1 Meter Readings Meter readings associated with the delivery of electric power to the Point(s) of Delivery shall be the responsibility of the Party owning such meters. In the event such meters are owned by Bonneville pursuant to the Power Agreements, Kittitas shall request that Bonneville provide such meter reading information directly to PSE. Alternatively, Kittitas shall, upon request by PSE, provide to PSE any such meter reading information made available to Kittitas by Bonneville. Electric power deliveries in any month shall be calculated on information based on meter readings with any necessary date adjustments made by prorating metered amounts to the number of days in such month. In the event a recording metering device is installed, actual monthly energy deliveries shall be determined from the record developed. B2 Meter Testing Unless provided by Bonneville pursuant to its agreements with Kittitas, PSE and/or Kittitas shall own and maintain all meters used to determine any billing associated with the delivery of electric power to the Point(s) of Delivery. PSE meters shall be tested and inspected in accordance with PSEs meter testing program (PSE Program) as filed with the Washington Utilities and Transportation Commission. If requested by Kittitas, PSE shall provide copies of applicable test and calibration records and calculations. PSE shall permit representatives of Kittitas and/or Bonneville to be present at all times the meters are being tested. Additionally, PSE shall test any or all of such meters as may reasonably be requested by Kittitas. Reasonable costs for such requested test shall be paid by Kittitas unless any of the meters are found to be inaccurate, as defined in the PSE Program, in which case PSE shall pay for the test. Kittitass meters shall be tested and inspected in accordance with Kittitas meter testing program (Kittitas Program). If requested by PSE, Kittitas shall provide copies of applicable test and calibration records and calculations. Kittitas shall permit a representative of PSE to be present at all times the meters are being tested. Additionally, Kittitas shall test any or all such meters as may reasonably be requested by PSE. Reasonable costs for such requested test shall be paid by PSE unless any of the meters are found to be inaccurate, as defined in Kittitas Program, in which case Kittitas shall pay for the test. For meters owned by Bonneville, PSE and Kittitas consent to the testing and inspection of such meters in accordance with Bonnevilles applicable meter testing program (Bonneville Program). If requested by PSE, Kittitas shall provide copies of applicable test and calibration records and calculations made available to Kittitas by Bonneville. Kittitas shall permit a representative of PSE to be present at all times such meters are being tested. Additionally, Kittitas shall request a test of any or all such meters as may reasonably be requested by PSE. Reasonable costs for such requested test shall be paid by PSE unless any of the meters are found to be inaccurate, as defined in the Bonneville Program, in which case PSE shall not be required to pay for the test. B3 Adjustments Adjustments shall be made in meter readings and billings for errors in a meter reading or billing discovered within twelve (12) months of the error. Each Party shall permit representatives of the other Party to inspect all of the records, including any records made available by Bonneville to Kittitas or PSE, relating to the delivery of electric power to Kittitas, and the transmission of electric power by PSE to the Points of Delivery.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: Section 12 Relationship of Parties 12.1 Nothing contained herein shall be construed to create an association, joint venture, trust, or partnership, or impose a trust or partnership covenant, obligation, or liability on or with regard to any one or more of the Parties. Each Party shall be individually responsible for its own covenants, obligations, and liabilities under this Agreement. 12.2 All rights of the Parties are several, not joint No Party shall be under the control or shall be deemed to control another Party. Except as expressly provided in this Agreement, no Party shall have a right or power to bind another Party without its express written consent.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: Section 8 Uncontrollable Forces and Liability 8.1 Uncontrollable Forces. Neither Party shall be considered to be in default in performance of any obligation hereunder if failure of performance shall be due to uncontrollable forces. The term uncontrollable forces means any cause beyond the control of the Party affected, including, but not limited to, failure or loss of facilities, flood, earthquake, storm, fire, lightning, epidemic, war, riot, civil disturbance, labor disturbance, sabotage, and restraint by court order or public authority, which by exercise of reasonable foresight, such Party could not reasonably have been expected to avoid, and which by exercise of reasonable diligence it will be unable to overcome. A Party shall not, however, be relieved of liability for failure of performance if such failure is due to causes arising out of its own negligence or to removable or remediable causes which it fails to remove or remedy with reasonable dispatch. Nothing contained herein, however, shall be construed to require a Party to prevent or settle a strike against its will. Damage to the electric system of either Kittitas or PSE caused by or arising out of an electrical disturbance shall be governed under Section 8.2 and not under the provisions of this Section 8.1. 8.2 Electric Disturbance. (a) For the purposes of this section, an electric disturbance is any sudden, unexpected, changed, or abnormal electric condition occurring in or on an electric system that causes automatic operation or damage. (b) Each Party shall design, construct, operate, maintain and use its electric system in conformance with Good Utility Practice: (i) to minimize electric disturbances such as, but not limited to, the abnormal flow of power which may damage or interfere with the electric system of the other Party or any electric system connected with such other Partys electric system; and (ii) to minimize the effect on its electric system and on its customers of electric disturbances originating on its own or another electric system. 8.3 Release and Limitation of Liability. If both Kittitas and PSE are parties to the Western Interconnected Systems Agreement Limiting Liability, that agreement shall continue in full force and effect as between the Parties to the extent that such provisions may apply under this Agreement. If either Kittitas or PSE is not a party to the Western Interconnected Systems Agreement Limiting Liability, then the following provisions shall apply: (a) Release by PSE. PSE hereby releases each of Kittitas and the directors, employees, agents and legal representatives of Kittitas from any and all claims, losses, harm, liabilities, damages, costs and expenses to the extent resulting from any: (i) operation of Kittitass electric system in parallel with PSEs electric system; (ii) electric disturbance or fluctuation that migrates, directly or indirectly, from Kittitass electric system to PSEs electric system; (iii) interruption, suspension or reduction of delivery of power from Kittitass electric system to PSEs electric system, regardless of whether such interruption, suspension or reduction is caused or contributed to by PSEs electric system or the interconnection of PSEs electric system with Kittitass electric system; or (iv) disconnection, interruption, suspension or curtailment, through manual operation, automatic operation or otherwise, by Kittitas in the event that Kittitas, in the exercise of its sole discretion, determines or has determined that an emergency condition exists or may exist that is contrary to Good Utility Practice, and failure to do so: (A) may cause imminent harm to any person or property, or (B) may cause the disruption of reliable operation of Kittitass or PSEs electric system (including, but not limited to, any transmission or distribution line thereof) or any electric system with which Kittitas is interconnected. The foregoing release shall not be effective to the extent any claims, losses, harm, liabilities, damages, costs, and expenses are the result of Kittitass willful misconduct. (b) Release by Kittitas. Kittitas hereby releases each of PSE and the directors, employees, agents and legal representatives of PSE from any and all claims, losses, harm, liabilities, damages, costs and expenses to the extent resulting from any: (i) operation of PSEs electric system in parallel with Kittitass electric system; (ii) electric disturbance or fluctuation that migrates, directly or indirectly, from PSEs electric system to Kittitass electric system; (iii) interruption, suspension or reduction of delivery of power from PSEs electric system to Kittitass electric system, regardless of whether such interruption, suspension or reduction is caused or contributed to by Kittitass electric system or the interconnection of Kittitass electric system with PSEs electric system; or (iv) disconnection, interruption, suspension or curtailment, through manual operation, automatic operation or otherwise, by PSE in the event that PSE, in the exercise of its sole discretion, determines or has determined that an emergency condition exists or may exist that is contrary to Good Utility Practice, and failure to do so: (A) may cause imminent harm to any person or property, or (B) may cause the disruption of reliable operation of PSEs or Kittitass electric system (including, but not limited to, any transmission or distribution line thereof) or any electric system with which PSE is interconnected. The foregoing release shall not be effective to the extent any claims, losses, harm, liabilities, damages, costs, and expenses are the result of PSEs willful misconduct. 8.4 Mutual Negotiation. Kittitas and PSE specifically warrant that the terms and conditions of the foregoing release provisions ale the subject of mutual negotiation by the Parties, and are specifically and expressly agreed to in consideration of the mutual benefits derived under the terms of this Agreement. 8.5 Insurance. (a) Each of Kittitas and PSE shall obtain and maintain commercial liability insurance with a single limit of coverage of not less than $5,000,000 for each occurrence. A certificate of such insurance shall be provided to either Party upon request by the other Party. Each Party shall promptly notify the other Party of any changes in its commercial liability insurance policies. (b) Upon the request by either Party, the minimum coverage limits for the commercial liability insurance shall be reviewed by the Parties and adjusted according to Good Utility Practice.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: Section 7 Operation and Maintenance 7.1 Operation and Maintenance of Interconnected Facilities. PSE and Kittitas, as each may be identified for performing such obligation in the attached Exhibit A, shall maintain the facilities enabling the Point(s) of Delivery described in the attached Exhibit A in good working order and shall operate and maintain their respective interconnected facilities pursuant to any applicable NERC and WECC criteria and Good Utility Practice. In performing its obligations pursuant to this Section 7.1, each Party shall adhere to the Substation Construction and Ownership Guidelines outlined in Exhibit C. 7.2 Operation of Kittitass Points of Delivery. PSE shall have primary operating responsibility in all PSE substations. This responsibility specifically includes the distribution feeder protective device at each Point of Delivery in PSE substations, and all switching operations in such substations. Operation of any apparatus owned by Kittitas in PSEs substations shall be the responsibility of Kittitas, subject to switching orders received from PSE system operations personnel. Any Kittitas personnel entering a PSE substation shall notify PSE system operations of their presence and their operational intentions. Operation of Kittitass equipment at each Point of Delivery not located in a PSE substation shall be coordinated with PSE system operations personnel to the extent practicable pursuant to Good Utility Practice. 7.3 Operators Qualifications. Kittitass personnel who perform operations in PSEs substations or on line facilities at a Point of Delivery are required to meet the National Electric Safety Codes (NESC) training and qualification criterion for Substation operators. Kittitas shall ensure that each of such personnel are familiar with the operation of all substation or line facilities and equipment that concern his or her position and are fully aware of the hazards connected therewith, or have passed a journeymans examination for the particular branch of the electrical trades with which he or she may be connected. 7.4 Power Quality. The interconnection of PSE and Kittitas facilities requires mutual responsibilities with respect to quality of service to both Parties customers. (a) Character of Service. Unless otherwise provided in this Agreement, PSE will make electric power available in the form of three-phase alternating current at a nominal frequency of sixty (60) hertz. (b) Abnormal Voltage Magnitudes. Each of the Parties shall operate and maintain its facilities such that the other Partys steady-state voltage levels at each Point of Delivery are manageable to within +/-10% of the steady-state operating voltage specified for such Point of Delivery. Each of the Parties shall also design, construct, operate and maintain its electric facilities in accordance with Good Utility Practice to reduce to acceptable levels any momentary voltage fluctuations that affect the other Partys facilities. (c) Frequency Control. Each of the Parties shall operate and maintain its system to enable the PSE control area to maintain its frequency control obligations to applicable regional operating criteria. (d) Harmonic Control. Each Party shall design, construct, operate, maintain and use its electric facilities in accordance with the IEEE 519 standard and Good Utility Practice to reduce to acceptable levels the harmonic currents and voltages which pass into the other Partys facilities. Harmonic reductions shall be accomplished with equipment that is specifically designed and permanently operated and maintained as an integral part of the facilities of the Party that owns the system on which harmonics are generated. 7.5 Reactive Power. The Parties shall jointly plan and operate their interconnected electrical facilities pursuant to Good Utility Practice in order to minimize the reactive power requirements placed upon the other Party. Pursuant to such joint planning and operation, PSE may require Kittitas, at the expense of Kittitas, to install necessary equipment or implement necessary operating practices on Kittitass system to ensure that deliveries at the Points of Delivery, pursuant to any transmission service agreement, are at a power factor no less than 0.95 leading or lagging. 7.6 Balancing Phase Demands. If requested by PSE at any time during the term of this Agreement and pursuant to Good Utility Practice, Kittitas shall make such changes as are necessary on its system to balance the phase currents at any Point of Delivery such that the current of any one phase does not deviate by more than five (5) percent (or such other percentage as may be agreed to by the Parties) from the average of the currents on all three phases. 7.7 Remedial Actions. PSE may require Kittitas to participate in or carry Kittitass pro rata share of any remedial action scheme that may be required to support the reliability of PSEs system or the regional or sub-regional transmission systems. In such case, PSE and Kittitas shall jointly plan and coordinate the implementation of the required remedial action scheme pursuant to Good Utility Practice. 7.8 Automatic Under-Frequency Load Shedding Protection. PSE may require Kittitas to participate up to its pro rata share in an automatic under-frequency load shedding program required to support the reliability of PSEs system or the regional or sub-regional transmission systems. Such pro-rata share shall be determined by the proportion of the total load of Kittitass Native Load Customers to the sum of the total loads of PSEs Native Load Customers, Kittitass Native Load Customers and the native load customers of other parties served directly by PSEs Transmission System. PSE and Kittitas shall jointly plan and coordinate the implementation of such protection pursuant to Good Utility Practice; provided, however, that Kittitas shall have the right to specify which of its loads are to apply to meet its pro rata obligation for automatic under-frequency load shedding. If such loads are served via a Point of Delivery where Kittitas owns the distribution feeder protection device, PSE may require Kittitas to provide, install, operate and maintain the necessary relay equipment on Kittitass distribution system, at Kittitass cost. 7.9 Generating Project. Kittitas shall require that any Generating Project shall agree by contract to plan and interconnect the Generating Project consistent with Good Utility Practice and the standards, criteria, and requirements of NERC, WECC and other regulatory authorities having jurisdiction. 7.10 Maintenance Responsibility. The owner of any equipment shall retain maintenance responsibility for such equipment, except for any required earth excavation inside a substation as provided below. (a) Excavation Inside a PSE Substation. Any earth excavation inside a PSE substation shall be performed by PSE or PSEs authorized agents and shall be the responsibility of PSE. To the extent that excavation is performed on behalf of Kittitas, for Kittitass sole or joint benefit, Kittitas shall reimburse PSE for an appropriate share of the costs associated with such excavation. (b) Excavation Inside a Kittitas Substation. Any earth excavation inside a Kittitas substation shall be performed by Kittitas or Kittitass authorized agents and shall be the responsibility of Kittitas. To the extent that excavation is performed on behalf of PSE, for PSEs sole or joint benefit, PSE shall reimburse Kittitas for an appropriate share of the costs associated with such excavation. 7.11 Maintenance Scheduling and Continuity of Service. The Parties shall coordinate their respective equipment maintenance schedules so as to minimize any effects upon either Party due to temporary interruptions associated with such maintenance PSE may temporarily interrupt or curtail service at the Points of Delivery: (a) upon reasonable notice to Kittitas in order to install equipment in, make repairs, replacements, investigations, and inspections of or perform other maintenance work on PSEs system; provided, however, that PSE shall give Kittitas prior notice thereof, the reason therefor, and the probable duration thereof; and (b) without prior notice of such interruption or curtailment as may be necessary because of uncontrollable forces as provided in Section 8. PSE shall use reasonable efforts to avoid interference with the operations of Kittitas and to repair the cause of any such interruption or curtailment. The Parties shall use reasonable efforts to provide for effective communication protocols between their respective operating personnel for the purpose of communicating any apparent cause and expected duration of any such interruption or curtailment of an extended nature.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: Section 9 Miscellaneous 9.1 Notices. Any notice to be served, given or made in connection with this Agreement, shall be in writing and shall be deemed properly served, given or made if delivered in person or sent by United States mail, properly addressed and stamped with the required postage, as follows: If to PSE: Puget Sound Energy, Inc.355 - 110th Avenue NE, EST-06EBellevue, Washington 98004Attn: Manager, Transmission Contracts and OASIS Trading If to Kittitas: PUD #1 of Kittitas County1400 Vantage HighwayEllensburg, WA 98926Attn: Chuck Ward, General Manager Either Party may change its address specified in this section by giving the other Party notice of such change in accordance with this section. 9.2 Notices of an Operating Nature. Any notice associated with day-to-day electric utility operations, such as for outage coordination or the need to enter a jointly-owned substation, may be provided by telephone, electronic mail or facsimile between appropriate operations personnel representing both Parties. 9.3 Amendment. No change, modification or amendment of this Agreement shall be valid unless set forth in a written instrument signed by both Parties. 9.4 Assignment. Neither Party shall assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Party. Subject to the foregoing restriction on assignment, this Agreement shall be binding upon, inure to the benefit of and be enforceable by the Parties and their successive successors and assigns; provided, however, that each Party hereby consents to assignment of this Agreement to a successor where a Party sells or transfers all or substantially all of its electric utility operating plant to a third party. 9.5 No Third-Party Beneficiary. There are no third-party beneficiaries of this Agreement. This Agreement shall not confer any right or remedy upon any person or entity other than the Parties and their respective successors and assigns permitted under Section 9.4. No action may be commenced or prosecuted against any Party by any third party claiming to be a third-party beneficiary of this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby. This Agreement shall not release or discharge any obligation or liability of any third party to any party or give any third party any right of subrogation or action over or against any Party. 9.6 Implementation. PSE shall timely file this Agreement with the Commission. Each Party shall take such additional action as may be reasonably required for the implementation and performance of this Agreement in accordance with its terms.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: Section 11 Waiver A waiver at any time by a Party of its rights with respect to a default by another Party under this Agreement, or with respect to any other matter arising in connection with this Agreement, shall not be deemed a waiver with respect to any subsequent default or matter. No delay, short of the statutory period of limitations, in asserting or enforcing any right hereunder shall be deemed a waiver of such right.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2

record_data.record_plain_text: Section 10 Default In the event that either Kittitas or PSE commits a material breach of or default under this Agreement (the Defaulting Party), the following shall apply: (a) The other Party (the Non-Defaulting Party) may give mitten notice to the Defaulting Party of the material breach or default. (b) If after thirty (30) days following receipt of such notice, the Defaulting Party has not taken the steps necessary to cure such breach or default, the Non-Defaulting Party may, at its option, terminate this Agreement; provided, however, that if the Defaulting Party within such 30-day period commences and thereafter proceeds with all due diligence to cure such default, such 30-day period shall be extended up to six (6) months after written notice to the Defaulting Party, as may be necessary to cure the material breach or default with all due diligence. Whether or not the Non-Defaulting Party elects to terminate this Agreement, it may, in addition to other remedies provided for herein, pursue such remedies as are available at law or in equity. (c) The Non-Defaulting Party may, at its option, cure (or cause to be cured) any material breach or default hereunder within the appropriate time period, without waiver of any remedy at law or in equity including the right of reimbursement. The right of the Non-Defaulting Party to cure any breach or default by the Defaulting Party shall not be construed or interpreted as obligating such Non-Defaulting Party to make any such cure. (d) A Defaulting Party shall be liable to the Party claiming default for all costs, including costs of collection and reasonable attorneys fees incurred by such Party claiming default. The proceeds paid by any Defaulting Party to remedy any such default shall be distributed to the Party claiming default in proportion to the additional cost actually paid by the Party claiming default as a result of the default.
record_data.filing_title: PSE Original Service Agreement No. 508 v2
